page.title: 12Carlisle Citadel Station(ii)
page.content: {__>_ "IT'S THE AGE OF THE TRAIN" __>_ {_<__ _<__} Until the Beeching cuts of the 1960's, seven lines ran into Carlisle.The Wav- erly route to Edinburgh and the Silloth line were closed then. The fate of the dramatic trans-Pennine Settle & Carlisle line depends upon the outcome of a public inquiry not yet held. Few tears were shed over the failures of the APT, which was not initially planned to stop in Carlisle. Second class{Saver}fares make rail travel attractive, though crowded, noisy, open-plan carriages, albeit with air-conditioning, and the smell from the brakes, can be irritating. {LONDON SAVER Blue Days Â£24 Return} White Days Â£32 (All Fridays Sat/Sun 29 June-25 Aug) Return from Euston any train except between 1440-1730. Fastest journey time: 3 hrs 50 mins
